headline: Overnight Steel-Cut Oats with Yogurt and Blueberries
description: These overnight steel-cut oats with yogurt, stevia powder, coconut milk, and blueberries are easy and delicious way to start your day.
name: Overnight Steel-Cut Oats with Yogurt and Blueberries
recipeIngredient: 0.5 ounce stevia powder (such as Pure Via®)

recipeInstructions.text: Place oats into the bottom of a 1-pint Mason jar. Stir in yogurt, blueberries, and stevia powder. Pour in coconut milk and stir to combine.
Cover the jar and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was easy fast and clean. The one thing I did change was the yogurt.I used greek vanilla yogurt which was easy and yummy!I also used strawberries and just cut them into cubes.
I made oats with blueberries cinnamon apple slices, added hemp hearts,chia seeds, oat bran & gr. Flaxseed. picture wouldn’t upload unfortunately

5.16.19 Used low-fat Greek yogurt and didn’t add the stevia because the blueberries and coconut milk sweetened this enough for my taste. You need to really like yogurt to enjoy this (and I do) because the tangy yogurt flavor dominates over the oats and even the blueberries. This really is more like “yogurt with oats” instead of “oats with yogurt.” If I make this again, I definitely would add more oats. Also, this is a huge serving for one person, and more realistically, it serves two (at least IMO). I like all of the ingredients in this recipe, but the proportions will need to be modified a bit for my taste preference. Thanks for the recipe.

item.name: Overnight Steel-Cut Oats with Yogurt and Blueberries
